channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Trump admin is withholding over $6 billion in education grants for schools
item.description: The federal grant funding traditionally goes out by July 1. It includes support for migrant education, after-school programs and English language lear...

item.title: RFK Jr. singled out one study to cut funds for global vaccines. Is that study valid?
item.description: When RFK Jr. announced he would cut funds from Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, he cited "vaccine safety," referring to a 2017 study from Guinea-Bissau. We...

item.title: Televangelist Jimmy Swaggart dies at age 90
item.description: Jimmy Swaggart, one of the most well-known televangelists of the 1980s, has died, according to a social media post from his ministry.

item.title: Waffle House drops egg surcharge as prices fall back to Earth
item.description: Waffle House has dropped its 50 cent surcharge on eggs as supplies rebound. The chain added the temporary charge in February, when avian flu sent egg ...

item.title: The White House took down the nation's top climate report. You can still find it here
item.description: The National Climate Assessment is the most influential source of information about climate change in the United States.

item.title: The man accused of killing 2 Idaho firefighters had once aspired to be one
5 smart ways to use $100,000 in home equity right now
item.description: Thinking about tapping $100,000 in home equity? These strategies could help grow your wealth — or protect it.

item.title: Jihadist fighters stage series of attacks on Mali military posts
item.description: Tuesday's attack marks the third major assault on army positions over the past month.

item.title: Three killed in Ukrainian drone attack on central Russia
item.description: The attack on a factory in the city of Izhevsk was more than 1,000km (620 miles) from the border.

item.title: Over 100 charities and NGOs call for end of controversial Gaza aid group
item.description: 130 humanitarian organizations are calling for the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation to be shut down. CBS News foreign correspondent Debora Patta reports.

item.title: Spain and England record hottest June as heatwave grips Europe
item.description: Several European regions had their highest temperatures on the last day of June, as a heatwave continues into July.

item.title: The best job markets in the U.S., according to SmartAsset study
item.description: New study​ ranks the best job markets in the U.S. based on commute times, access to employer health insurance and other factors.

item.title: US Senate Republicans narrowly pass Trump's 'big, beautiful' bill
item.description: Vice-President JD Vance casts the tie-breaking vote after more than 24 hours of intense debate, sending the bill back to the House.
